articles.title: Estimated 2.5 billion T. rex roamed Earth, but not all at once — study - TVNZ
articles.description: The species roamed North America for about 1.2 to 3.6 million years, meaning its population density was small at any one moment.
articles.content: One Tyrannosaurus rex seems scary enough. Now picture 2.5 billion of them. Thats how many of the fierce dinosaur king probably roamed Earth over the course of a couple million years, a new study find… [+2459 chars]

articles.author: AFP
articles.title: Chicago releases video of police shooting 13-year-old dead - New Straits Times
articles.description: CHICAGO: Authorities in Chicago released police body camera footage Thursday showing an officer shooting dead a 13-year-old Latino boy as the mayor of America’s third-largest city appealed for calm over the “excruciating” video.

articles.author: Cydney Contreras
articles.title: How Cassie Randolph Reacted After Ex Colton Underwood Publicly Came Out as Gay - E! NEWS
articles.description: A source exclusively told E! News how Cassie Randolph feels about Colton Underwood coming out in an interview with Good Morning America, and if she knew about his plans in advance.
articles.content:
Cassie Randolph and Colton Underwood dated for nearly two years, but after going through a messy breakup, a source exclusively tells E! News they are "not in communication."

articles.author: Laura López González
articles.title: Africa could produce a Covid-19 vaccine sooner than you think - Mail and Guardian
articles.description: In mere months, Moderna transformed an old Polaroid factory in America into a state-of-the-art vaccine-production centre. Why can’t we do the same?
articles.content: In the 1980s, a factory in Norwood, Massachusetts, churned out Polaroids iconic camera film. Polaroid is best-known for its instant camera, which produced a photo that developed before the eyes and w… [+8755 chars]

articles.author: Aamer Madhani And Matthew Lee
articles.title: Biden to pull remaining U.S. troops from Afghanistan, end America’s longest war - Global News
articles.description: The U.S. cannot continue to pour resources into an intractable war and expect different results, Biden said.
articles.content: President Joe Biden said Wednesday he will withdraw remaining U.S. troops from Afghanistan, declaring that the Sept. 11 attacks “cannot explain” why American forces should still be there 20 years aft… [+6076 chars]
